alert.note: Alert for Morton; Oliver; Sioux (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 9:42PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT/NOON MDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Montrail, portions of McLean, Mercer, Morton, Grant, and Sioux * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT Friday /noon MDT Friday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring from snowpack melting. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 PM CDT /837 PM MDT/, emergency management reported Rapid snowmelt is occurring and will continue to cause flooding. In addition, the snowpack has been soaking into the ground and the upper portions of soils are becoming saturated. Areas that have appreciable snowpack remaining will see additional runoff in the coming days as the ponding water eventually makes its way through frozen culverts and into the waterways. County and township roads may flood due to high water and plugged culverts. - Mainly rural areas will be affected, but towns and cities may also experience localized flooding issues
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
